did.unittitle: Frank R. Oakley Civil War papers
did.abstract: The Frank R. Oakley Civil War papers consist primarily of transciptions of orders issued by Stephen Mallory, Secretary of the Confederate Navy during the American Civil War, to naval officers in Richmond Virginia and elsewhere, dated 1862. Accompanying these documents are two letters written to Oakley by United States Secretary of State William H. Seward, dated 1865.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1974.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in two folders.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Frank R. Oakley lived at 4 Willow Street in Brooklyn Heights.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Frank R. Oakley Civil War papers consist primarily of transciptions of orders issued by Stephen Mallory, Secretary of the Confederate Navy during the American Civil War, to naval officers in Richmond Virginia and elsewhere, dated 1862. Accompanying these documents are two letters written to Oakley by United States Secretary of State William H. Seward, dated 1865. These letters thank Oakley for sending Seward copies of Mallory's orders.
